page.title: 14Life of a Helicopter Pilot
page.content: There are 2 areas of operation in the North Sea. (a){The East Shetland Basin}involving a round trip of about 3 hours. (b){East of Aberdeen}with a round trip of about 2 hours. Short haul flights are carried out twice daily. Paul feels that the popular image of a pilot is a rather glamourous one. He is not particularly well-paid (Â£14,000 p.a.) and he derives little pleasure from piloting a craft which is "noisy, vibrates, is cramped and hot as a greenhouse". The highlight of each trip is the meal they receive when they reach the Rig. Paul does not feel that he will stay in Aberdeen or Helicopters much longer. Aberdeen is expensive and cold and he would prefer fixed-wing Aircraft to Helicopters.
